column4: so are there any advanced Linux useres here that can help??? so far I have been completly unable to get any help...
i sure don't want to go back to windows but I am about to also.. I can't even get my other computer to boot up... hopefully Ill find some help sooner or later...
What happens when you disable acpi in the bios?
nothing seams to change.. I could try again.. but i believe I had the same error.. let me quickly try
i was incorrect when i disable it gets past that to the next line which says ACPI: setting ELCR to 0200 (from 0c28) and it does still above say DSDT not found
in your grub menu, edit the entry and add acpi=off to the bootoptions
that goes on the same line at root=?? right
also I recommend you check to make sure you have the latest bios revision
i already loaded the latest bios this morning and now my Kernel line says /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.15-25-686 root=/dev/hda1 ro acpi=off single
hold on.. its doing more....  man.. i swear i did that earlier.. but it seams to have worked..
well thank you for taking the time.. hopefully I won't have to bother you again... but im in now.. and ill make perminent edits to the boot files...
good luck, glad to get ya going
